buildup.text: Copper was hammered into tubes to carry water for temple rituals and drain bathwater from palaces along the Nile.

discovery.text: The shadufâ€”a pivoting counterweight leverâ€”lifted Nile water into channels. One worker moved 2,500 liters daily.

twist.text: Egypt also invented the water clock (clepsydra), using regulated flow to measure time with remarkable accuracy.

climax.text: Egypt's water engineering fed 3 million in a desert. Without it, one of history's greatest civilizations couldn't exist.

punchline.text: Civilization rose where water was tamed.
